titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1218
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1218

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

mw tʾlb rymm bʿl trʿt ṣlm=

m b-ḏt ṣdq w-hwfyn tʾlb ʿbd-h=

b-msʾl-hw w-ḥmd ʾwslt mqm tʾ=

sʿd ʿbd-hw ʾwslt ʾwldm ʾḏkr=

lʾn b-ʿm-hw w-l sʿd-hmw wfy-hw w-w=
fy ʾwld-hmw w-l gyb-hmw bn nḍʿ

ʾṯmrm hnʾm ʿdy ʾrḍ-hmw

mw tʾlb rymm bʿl trʿt ṣlm=

sʿd ʿbd-hw ʾwslt ʾwldm ʾḏkr=

lʾn b-ʿm-hw w-l sʿd-hmw wfy-hw w-w=

1.[ʾAwslā]t Rifshān bin ʾAʿyān [has dedicated to their patron-god] 2.Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Turʿa[t (this) statue] 3.as he had commanded them in his oracle, [out of gratitude] 4.[be]cause Taʾlab had maintained and protected [his servant] 5.ʾAwslāt, by granting him property in [..] 6.the alliance of his son Nashaʾkarib bin [... ...] 7.in his oracle. And ʾAwslāt expressed gratitude to the po[wer of Taʾ=] 8.[lab be]cause he had maintained and protected him through his oracle, 9.as he had promised him. And (ʾAwslāt has made this dedication) in order that [Taʾlab] might continue 10.[to] grant his servant ʾAwslāt healthy [male] children 11.and maintain him through all the oracles that he might seek 12.from him. And may he grant them his well-being [and the well-] 13.being of their children. And may he defend them against the male[volence] 14.and hostility and malice of any enemy. And may he gran[t them] 15.healthy [cr]ops in th[eir] land 16.[and] their [fields]. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

ʾAwslāt Rifshān bin ʾAʿyān has dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Turʿat this statue
as he had commanded them in his oracle, out of gratitude
because Taʾlab had maintained and protected his servant
ʾAwslāt, by granting him property in ..
the alliance of his son Nashaʾkarib bin
in his oracle. And ʾAwslāt expressed gratitude to the power of Taʾ=
lab because he had maintained and protected him through his oracle,
as he had promised him. And ʾAwslāt has made this dedication in order that Taʾlab might continue
to grant his servant ʾAwslāt healthy male children
and maintain him through all the oracles that he might seek
from him. And may he grant them his well-being and the well-
being of their children. And may he defend them against the malevolence
and hostility and malice of any enemy. And may he grant them
healthy crops in their land
and their fields. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

ʾAwslāt Rifshān bin ʾAʿyān has dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Turʿat this statue
as he had commanded them in his oracle, out of gratitude
because Taʾlab had maintained and protected his servant
ʾAwslāt, by granting him property in ..
the alliance of his son Nashaʾkarib bin
in his oracle. And ʾAwslāt expressed gratitude to the power of Taʾ=
lab because he had maintained and protected him through his oracle,
as he had promised him. And ʾAwslāt has made this dedication in order that Taʾlab might continue
to grant his servant ʾAwslāt healthy male children
and maintain him through all the oracles that he might seek
from him. And may he grant them his well-being and the well-
being of their children. And may he defend them against the malevolence
and hostility and malice of any enemy. And may he grant them
healthy crops in their land
and their fields. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

ʾAwslāt Rifshān bin ʾAʿyān has dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Turʿat this statue
as he had commanded them in his oracle, out of gratitude
because Taʾlab had maintained and protected his servant
ʾAwslāt, by granting him property in ..
the alliance of his son Nashaʾkarib bin
in his oracle. And ʾAwslāt expressed gratitude to the power of Taʾ=
lab because he had maintained and protected him through his oracle,
as he had promised him. And ʾAwslāt has made this dedication in order that Taʾlab might continue
to grant his servant ʾAwslāt healthy male children
and maintain him through all the oracles that he might seek
from him. And may he grant them his well-being and the well-
being of their children. And may he defend them against the malevolence
and hostility and malice of any enemy. And may he grant them
healthy crops in their land
and their fields. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
